Package studentinfo.project3

Class TuitionManagerController

java.lang.Object
studentinfo.project3.TuitionManagerController
public class TuitionManagerController extends Object
This class contains methods that will manage the behavior of the graphical user interface roster
Author:
David Fabian, Steven Tan

  • Constructor Details

    • TuitionManagerController

      public TuitionManagerController()

  • Method Details

    • addStudent

      void addStudent()
      Adds a student to studentRoster when the user clicks on the "Add" button if the user has appropriately filled the specified data fields

    • addResident

      private void addResident()
      Creates a Resident object, and adds it to the student roster if the student's profile is not in the roster.

    • addInternational

      private void addInternational()
      Creates an International object, and adds it to the student roster if the student's profile is not in the roster.

    • addNonResident

      private void addNonResident()
      Creates a NonResident object, and adds it to the student roster if the student's profile is not in the roster.

    • addTriState

      private void addTriState()
      Creates a TriState object, and adds it to the student roster if the student's profile is not in the roster.

    • enrollStudent

      private void enrollStudent()
      Takes in the user's input arguments to enroll the student specified for the semester. Adds the student to the enrollment list if the student eligible regarding their credits and is in the student roster. Prints error messages for invalid input, if any.

    • dropStudent

      private void dropStudent()
      Drops the student that is enrolled for the semester, if in the enrollment list. Prints error messages for invalid input or if the student is not in the enrollment list.

    • awardScholarship

      private void awardScholarship()
      Awards the specified student with the amount inputted by the user. Prints error messages for invalid input, if the student is ineligible for the scholarship, or if the student is not in the roster.

    • isScholarshipEligible

      private Resident isScholarshipEligible(Profile checkProfile)
      Checks if a student is eligible for a scholarship given their profile. Used in junction with the awardScholarship method. Prints error messages for an invalid Profile, if it is.
      Parameters:
      checkProfile - Profile for which to check if eligible for a scholarship.
      Returns:
      a Resident object if the student is eligible; NULL otherwise.

    • readCompletedCredits

      private int readCompletedCredits(String input)
      This method checks the validity of a String command inputted by the user relating to the number of completed credits
      Parameters:
      input - the input command String that is being read by the Scanner
      Returns:
      number of credits taken if the input is valid, -1 if the input is invalid

    • birthDate

      private String birthDate()
      Used to give the Student's birthDate in the proper mm/day/year format
      Returns:
      a String representation of the birthDate

    • removeStudent

      void removeStudent()
      Removes the specified student from studentRoster when the user clicks on the "Remove" button If the student is not found or the specified details are incorrect, an error message appears

    • readProfile

      private Profile readProfile()
      This method checks the validity of a String command inputted by the user relating to the Profile class
      Returns:
      a Profile object if the components inputted are valid and null if invalid

    • changeStudentMajor

      void changeStudentMajor()
      This method changes the student's major, given the student's profile and the new major

    • isDate

      private boolean isDate(String input)
      Checks whether the argument String is in the correct calendar date format (mm/dd/yyyy) with numeric values for day, month, and year. Prints error messages for invalid input.
      Parameters:
      input - a String to be checked for proper calendar Date formatting.
      Returns:
      true if the String is properly formatted as described; false otherwise.

    • isNumeric

      private boolean isNumeric(String input)
      This method checks the validity of a String command inputted by the user relating to whether it is numeric
      Parameters:
      input - the input command String that is being read by the Scanner
      Returns:
      true if the input is a numeric number, false if it is not a numeric number.

    • checkIfResident

      void checkIfResident()
      Checks if the Resident or NonResident buttons has been selected. If the Resident button is selected, the buttons relating to Non-Resident students are disabled and unselected

    • checkIfTriStateOrInternational

      void checkIfTriStateOrInternational()
      Checks if the Tri-State or International button has been selected. If the Tri-State button is selected, the Study Abroad button is disabled. If the International button is selected, the NY and CT buttons are disabled.

    • importFile

      void importFile()
      Open a file dialog for user to select text file containing details of students to be added to the student roster. Prints an error if no file is selected.

    • loadList

      private void loadList(File file)
      Loads the list of students in a text file with all the details of a student on each line and adds them to the student roster.
      Parameters:
      file - File object that contains the text file path.

    • readProfile

      private Profile readProfile(StringTokenizer tokens)
      This method checks the validity of a String command inputted by the user relating to the Profile class
      Parameters:
      tokens - StringTokenizer that contains Profile information
      Returns:
      a Profile object if the components inputted by the string command are valid and null if invalid

    • printRoster

      void printRoster()
      Prints the student roster in the output TextArea. If the roster is empty, the output TextArea says that the roster is empty

    • printByStanding

      void printByStanding()
      Prints the student roster in the output TextArea. If the roster is empty, the output TextArea says that the roster is empty

    • printBySchool

      void printBySchool()
      Prints the student roster in the output TextArea. If the roster is empty, the output TextArea says that the roster is empty

    • listByRBS

      void listByRBS()
      Prints the students in order by last name, first, DOB by RBS students This method sorts the students by their profile. This is done by comparing the student's majors and schools Then it prints the students that are in the specified school

    • listBySAS

      void listBySAS()
      Prints the students in order by last name, first, DOB by SAS students This method sorts the students by their profile. This is done by comparing the student's majors and schools Then it prints the students that are in the specified school

    • listBySCI

      void listBySCI()
      Prints the students in order by last name, first, DOB by SC&I students This method sorts the students by their profile. This is done by comparing the student's majors and schools Then it prints the students that are in the specified school

    • listBySOE

      void listBySOE()
      Prints the students in order by last name, first, DOB by SOE students This method sorts the students by their profile. This is done by comparing the student's majors and schools Then it prints the students that are in the specified school

    • readEnrolledCredits

      private int readEnrolledCredits(Student enrolled, String input)
      Takes in a Student object and a String representing the amount of credits the student with the profile is enrolling with. Prints error messages if the student cannot take these amount of credits or for invalid input.
      Parameters:
      enrolled - Student object to be enrolled with the specified credits.
      input - String representing the amount of enrolling credits.
      Returns:
      a positive integer if the Student can take those amount of credits; -1 otherwise.

    • studentType

      private String studentType(Student inspectStudent)
      Checks for the type of specific student given. Return a String representing that type.
      Parameters:
      inspectStudent - the Student object to be checked for the type.
      Returns:
      String representing the type of Student object given.

    • printEnrolledStudent

      void printEnrolledStudent()
      Prints the student roster in the output TextArea. If the roster is empty, the output TextArea says that the roster is empty

    • printTuition

      void printTuition()
      Prints the amount of tuition owed by the currently enrolled students alongside with their details.

    • completeSemester

      void completeSemester()
      Completes the current semester by awarding the credits enrolled by each student in the enrollment list. If any are eligible to graduate with the amount of current credits, they are printed afterwards.
